result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus A McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.

***SENTENCE OF 6-20-2016 IS HEREBY VACATED.***

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample, if not previously provided.  Pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Not to enter any bars, liquor stores or other establishments whose primary business is the dale of alcohol.  Not to associate with any know drug dealers or users.  Attend five self-help group meetings per week and provide written verification of attendance to agent.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample if one has not been provided.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order reversing

records.addlTxt: atty. Johnson
for Marcus McFarland from Kenosha County Correctional for Sentencing Hearing on Monday, August 20, 2018 at 10:30 AM - emailed RCSO at 9:58 a.m.

Defendant Marcus A McFarland in court with attorney Michelle Lee Velasquez.  Defendant Marcus A McFarland in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  Remanded from the Court of Appeals after reversal.  State violated plea agreement and we are here for resentencing.  Defense believes a Machner Hearing is necessary.  Defendant is fine with going to resentencing.  We will proceed to resentencing without making any findings of fault.  BTC:  Set for SEH.  PSI had been prepared previously and no new PSI is requested.  This case will go back to SPD trial division and a trial attorney will be appointed.  Defendant is being held in Kenosha County Correctional Center.  Defendant req. to remain where he is.  BTC:  Vacating SEH will be done at the resentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Marcus A McFarland in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Defendant Marcus A McFarland in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
